channel.title: PHP and Variables
channel.description:
One of the aspects I don't like about PHP is that on certain calls to undefined variables or functions, it will not display an error, but return a default value. This is annoying me.
And then calling variables from other PHP files sometimes returns errors, sometimes it will return weird or undefined values.
I'm using a seperate class for header and footer via include(), and it would be cool if I could automatically "extend" all of my classes. Any way to do this?
Kinda like: OtherPHPFile.performMethod(); in Java syntax.
Like for $_SESSION[], is there any way to create a 'global' session for all of your pages? Does it require defining more and more variables of basically the same thing?
Yea, I'm pretty sure you have to use the word 'global', but it doesn't work for me.
Thanks in advance, Whac
